textList.name: MILITIA_FREE_AMMO
textList.text: Nearby drifts the burnt husk of what surely was once a Militia transport. Little remains other than a single crate of ammunition.

You notice a mine drifting nearby, followed by several more. Most, if not all, are inactive, probably left over from some sort of training exercise. Fortunately, this means you can salvage them with relative ease.
A small refuelling drone flies past, stops, then returns to scan your ship. It identifies you as friendly and restocks your ammo supply free of charge before speeding off again.

event.name: MILITIA_CLANSMEN
event.text: You receive a hail from a Slug ship hiding behind a small moon. Upon closer inspection, it's clear the ship is staffed by Slug Clansmen, belonging to the Exotic Hunter's Guild.

"A fine sssship for a Multiverssse Traveller! When we heard the Militia accepted any sssspeciesss among their ranksss, I realisssed what an excccellent opportunity it would be to go hunting! But sssince you're here, perhapsss you have some sssspecimenss to donate? We will pay very well!"

choice.text: Draw straws and give a crew to the Slugs.

event.text: The Slugs take your crew back to their ship kicking and screaming. "Thiss one will make an exccccellent trophy! Sssome ssscrap for you, good ssssir."

removeCrew.text: Though your crew will likely be dead soon, you don't think cloning them is a good idea after you just gave them up to murderous hunters.

choice.text: Somehow, the Slugs have not even realised there's no one aboard to send over to them, despite their ability to detect lifeforms...
(Clansman Crew) Claim to be hunters yourself.

event.text: "Ahh, another hunter? To think I thought I wasss the firsssst with thisss idea... Oooh, your sssship isss ssso much larger than mine. You probably have ssso much more ssssuccesss!" The Slug offers his services. Hopefully he doesn't mind hunting Rebels.

choice.text: (Improved Armories) Claim to be hunters yourself.

event.text: "Ahh, another hunter? To think I thought I wasss the firsssst with thisss idea... Oooh, your sssship isss ssso much larger than mine. You probably have ssso much more ssssuccesss!" The Slug offers his services. Hopefully he doesn't mind hunting Rebels.
You engage the Clansmen.
"A ssshame. I alwayssss try to be polite firssst, but people rarely agree. Oh well, thissss will be a lot more fun now!"
"Ssssquares." The Clansmen jump away.

event.name: MILITIA_AUTOGRAPHS
event.text: In the distance is a densely populated planet under Militia control, with plenty of traffic to and from. You can likely find a market on the surface.

Near minutes after landing on the planet's surface you're swarmed by both Civilians, Federation officers, and Militia recruits. It appears they recognize you as a Multiverse Renegade, and are overtaken by stardom. Apparently it's rare to see ships like yours here.

choice.text: Ignore the fans and find a store.

event.text: You push past the crowds, apologizing to them as you go, and eventually find a market to shop at.

choice.text: Sign some autographs, but leave before the fleet can catch up.

event.text: You decide to stick around with the crowd, telling stories and signing autographs. You even receive some gifts, but eventually decide to get going before the Rebels can arrive.

choice.text: Stay back for a while with the fans.

event.text: You decide to stick around with the crowd, telling stories and signing autographs. The longer you stay the more gifts you're showered with, but eventually you have to call it quits before the Rebels can catch up any more.

choice.text: We don't need to go shopping right now.

event.text: You fly past the planet.

event.name: MILITIA_TEXTWALL
event.text: A Zoltan Peacekeeper is stationed nearby, speaking with several Militia ships. Eventually, all of the ships but the Zoltan jump away, and you receive a hail.

"Oh, hello. I am Boline, a Zoltan soldier for the Militia Corps. I've been working hard on a speech that I intend to share during the next meeting of the Galactic Union, but no one wants to listen to it or give me feedback. Would you mind if I shared them with you?"
"Wonderful! I shall now begin." Boline pulls out a massive book, slamming it down on the desk in front of her and pulls open the cover. She clears her throat, and begins to read...
"As I expected... carry on then..."

event.name: MILITIA_TEXTWALL_TEXT
event.text: "My fellow citizens of the Galactic Union, subsidiary of the United Federation and regulator of laws in Union territory, I have come to speak with you about a very important matter. Since the dawn of civilization we have been creatures bound to our weapons of war. Every race, Human, Zoltan, Aquarian, Rockman, Mantis, even Engi or Orchid, we have all waged wars not just against each other, but ourselves. It is beyond many of us, unthinkable even, to surrender these tools of destruction... nay, these evil and wicked thoughts that plague our civilizations. We say we wish to evolve, learn and grow, but how can we do this when we still hold so dear to us the ideas of revenge and hatred?"

"To emphasize my point, let me tell you all a story. Back during the infamous Mantis - Human war, a time when the seeds of thought that would grow to be the Federation had only just barely been planted, the Human people were in dire straits. The far more dangerous and warrior-like creatures that were the Mantis caused havoc among the unprepared human colonies. The Humans turned to the only allies they had at the time, the Engi, hoping for assistance. The Engi reluctantly accepted, but only in turn if the humans would liberate the slaves from the Mantis war camps. The two forces fought for years and years for control over the neighbouring planet Mars, which the Mantis had managed to secure as a stronghold and key point for planning their invasion. Rather than negotiating for a ceasefire, or surrendering, the human people continued to fight the Mantis to near extinction. The Mantis would show the humans no mercy either, and would not stop until humanity had been eradicated."

Boline clears her throat, and flips through a few pages, confused. "The uh... The Mantis are not the only violent race known to have staged such terrible wars. The Rock Inquisitions are perhaps some of the worst battles known to the galaxy. Believing themselves to be superior, the Rockmen sent forth battalions of armored ships staffed by trained soldiers known as the Crusaders to claim other territory in the name of the holy Rock Theocracy. The Chrysolic Faith that drove the Rockmen to such violence was the very same used by the Rock Elders to enslave their population through tactics of fear. Clearly an immoral action, it is known to many that the Rock dictatorship is perhaps one of the most violent and unforgiving forces in the galaxy."

"The religious persecution of the Rockmen government is not the only example of uh... of barbarianism leading to unjust treatment of other races. Going back to the Mantis, the Mantis race has for many years enslaved the Engi race for usage of their excellency at repairs. The Mantis race, due to their anatomy, are often incapable of performing precise work with electronics, though their claws have been known to function in place of screwdrivers or other tools from time to time. It is interesting to compare the differences between the two functionally opposite races. Similar duality is not often seen, though some have commented on the benefits of mixing Orchid and Rockmen crew together, due to the fire-proof nature of the Rockmen because of their hard, though not actually rock, exterior."

"However, it also stands to say that the Orchids may actually function better with the Shells, as their reliance on oxygen naturally would pair them with the plant beings. It is a scientific wonder how a single Orchid is capable of effectively replacing a Life Support system for extended periods of time. Many biologists, many of which coincidentally also happen to be Shells, have attempted to study Orchid biology. For those of you who might not be aware, the Shell race has placed a heavy focus on scientific study, even occasionally abducting tourists or visiting ships to run quick, albeit painless, tests. This has led to many cultural misunderstandings with the less understanding species, such as the Rockmen or Mantis. The Slugs also have a particular interest in the Shells, though not for any innocent reasons. A clan of Slug hobbyists known as the Exotic Hunters Guild has formed, whose specific purpose is to hunt rare or sapient creatures. The Shells are their prime targets, because of their armored abilities."

"Frighteningly, the attacks led by the EHG, that being the aforementioned Exotic Hunters Guild for any of those not paying attention, are near synonymous with the earlier but still relatively recent series of conflicts known as the Slug Expansion Wars. I'm sure many of you here are already aware of the history of the Slug Expansion Wars, but I will share a brief summary of the conflicts for those of you who aren't."

Boline licks the page and flips to the next. She coughs slightly, pounds on her chest, and continues to read. "Starting after the Rebellion's rise to power, the Federation forces were dedicated to clearing out Rebel ships from their territory. This left much of space unprotected from invaders. The Slugs, who had previously been shunned from the Federation for their traitorous nature, took notice to this pattern and began planning a mass migration to new territory. Though they started with nebulous sectors, they soon found themselves courageous enough to attack clear sectors, sometimes even already occupied space. This came to cause issues when the Slugs dared invade Mantis and Rock space, much to the reasonable displeasure of those governments. Both the Hive and Elders declared war on the Slugs, and so they fought for several years. Eventually, the Slugs surrendered and offered back territory. They didn't stop there however, and even offered some of their original territory up as well. This eventually evolved into an alliance that we have come to know as the Coalition."
"This lack of Federation protection over Union space also led to the rise of the Militia. However, I will spare you all this tale, as I know everyone here is for certain familiar with the story."

"I WILL however tell the story of the Coalition, in case you might not be aware. The Coalition is a truce between the Sethnian Kleptocracy, the Urtharean Theocracy, the Yeitiiik Hive, and the Eargen Republic. These 4 races are perhaps some of the most hostile and deadly in the galaxy, and this alliance has caused fear for both the Federation and Rebellion. The Coalition continues to grow in power, and even occupies several of its own sectors. The Coalition has also taken usage of Slug Cealaforming tech, a method of transporting nebulous gases to create artificial nebulas. Though these fake clouds are incapable of forming into stars, they still cause sensors to malfunction and can even generate the same electrical currents as ion storms, a deepspace hazard I'm sure any pilots here are definitely familiar with if you've ever been to a nebula sector."

"Cealaforming is not the only unique tech developed by the Slugs however. Many Slugs take use of Anti-Bio weaponry, which often used to be confused with Particle tech because of their similar orange colors, at least before Anti-Bio weaponry was transitioned to pink. Particle tech was actually developed by the Zoltan race on accident in junction with The Zufquair Corporation. Uh... wait no, that's spelled wrong."

"Wait... is it Zluficar? Zultifigar? I know it starts with a Z..." Boline flips back through her text, searching for something. "Ah, I spelled it right here. Zulfiqar, that's it. Now, where was I... Oh, damn I lost my page. Do you uh, do you want me to start again?"
Boline awaits your response.
"Ok, if you say so!" Boline flips back to page one. "From the top then."
"Oh, ok. Fair enough!" Boline flips the book closed. "Thanks for listening that far at least. So uh, what did you think?"

"Really? You liked it? Amazing! Thank you so much for your feedback. Oh man, no one has ever said anything nice about my speech before, not even my own crew! Hey uh, what if I joined yours? You seem much nicer, and maybe with your encouragement I can even finish this draft in time to present it!"

choice.text: Dear god that was the biggest waste of time in my life.

event.text: Boline looks down at her feet in shame. "Oh... ok." She cuts comms. You probably didn't have to be so rude, but at least you don't have to listen to her ramble any longer.
Boline awaits your response.

"Seriously? Again? I've read my speech to you 5 times already! Are you... making fun of me? Dude, not cool!" Seems you've really tipped her over the edge, because now Boline's weapons have come online!
"Oh, ok. Fair enough!" Boline flips the book closed. "Thanks for listening that far at least. So uh, what did you think?"

"Really? You liked it? Amazing! Thank you so much for your feedback. Oh man, no one has ever said anything nice about my speech before, not even my own crew! Hey uh, what if I joined yours? You seem much nicer, and maybe with your encouragement I can even finish this draft in time to present it!"

choice.text: Dear god that was the biggest waste of time in my life.

event.text: Boline looks down at her feet in shame. "Oh... ok." She cuts comms. You probably didn't have to be so rude, but at least you don't have to listen to her ramble any longer.
You power up the weapons and attack the Militiamen.
You fly past the Militia vessel.

textList.name: TEXT_MILITIA_CHOICE
textList.text: A Militia vessel is making small repairs to their hull after a fight. No other ships are nearby.
You notice another ship, belonging to the Militia, drifting some distance away. The ship is fully functional but politely declines any hails.
A decently armed Militia vessel is patrolling the beacon. Because of your Federation status, they don't mind you.

event.name: MILITIA_DEPOT
event.text: You spot a nearby Militia station. It seems to be offering supplies to travellers.

choice.text: Submit your ID and get some supplies.
Attack, surely we can get more from them!

event.text: You power up the weapons and attack the Militiamen.
You ignore the Militia station.

event.name: MILITIA_TRAINIES
event.text: A Militia training exercise appears to be going down at this beacon. Fortunately, they aren't aiming to kill and are a safe distance away from the beacon.

choice.text: Hail and see if you can get involved.

event.text: The leading commander of the squad responds. "You want to participate in the training? Go ahead - damaging the hull is fine, BUT! Don't mortally wound our rookies. We're reluctantly willing to... tolerate slip-ups if Clone Bays are involved, but regardless it'd be best if you exercised restraint. We'll end the exercise after 60 seconds."

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: The training exercise will end in this much time. Make sure not to kill anyone until then!

event.text: On second thought, participating in this might not be a great idea.
There's nothing of use here - you move on.

event.name: MILITIA_TRAINIES_KILL
event.text: Seems you accidentally took the training too far, and now there's blood on your hands. It takes a moment for the other ships to realize what's happening, but as soon as they find out you've killed their friends, they immediately abandon the exercise and fire at you. Your hull takes some damage, but you're able to fly away in time.

event.name: MILITIA_TRAINIES_WIN
event.text: The commander contacts you in person once the other ships disperse. "Thank you for your help! These are some of our newest recruits, they have little experience in actual combat. I'm sure going up against an actual Multiverse Renegade was quite the experience for them! I don't have much supplies to give you, but here's a combat augment we use for training, maybe you can find use in it."

event.name: MILITIA_RECRUITMENT
event.text: A Rebel ship has docked with a Militia recruitment center stationed at this beacon. Quick scans show the Rebels have taken the Militiamen hostage.
You power up the weapons and attack the Rebels.

choice.text: Contact the Rebels; try to talk them out of it.
(Upg. Cloaking) Cloak and scrap some of the Rebel ships while they're aboard.

event.text: With the Rebels occupied, there's no one around to guard their ships. Under the veil of your cloak you tear off some of the plating and leave quickly.

choice.text: (Monk Crew) Shame the Rebels for their violent ways.

event.text: Your Monk spends the next 30 minutes insulting the Rebels for their barbaric ways, attacking men only doing their duty by defending civilians. The Rebels are so ashamed of themselves several crumple to the floor sobbing. One particularly moved individual offers to join your crew, and the rest agree to leave the Militiamen alone.

choice.text: (Improved Armories) Arm the crew and board.

event.text: Seeing your crew armed to the teeth immediately puts the Rebels into panic, as they seemingly only expected underpaid Militia vessels to try and rescue the station. They surrender and let the Militiamen free. Most stay behind to handle the Rebels, but one soldier wishes to join you!
You fly past the Militia center. Hopefully, the situation will be resolved... no thanks to you.
The Rebels don't bother listening to you. They send over a team of crew to board you while you fight their ship.

The Rebels take a step back to listen to your speech. You assume it's not going to work, until they set down their weapons. Ashamed of attacking civilians, they head back to their ship and depart from the station. The Militiamen thank you and pay you for assisting them.

event.name: MILITIA_COCKY_ZOLTAN
event.text: A flotilla of Zoltan vessels is present at this beacon - they seem to be performing training drills related to the endurance of their Super Shields. One ship among the group hails you: "Uh. Renegades, here? Not a common sight in Militia space. You know, you really stand out from the rest of the ships in this sector..."

"I mean, your cobbled-up and makeshift tech! Have you no shame, comparing your Federation to our orderly discipline and advanced shield technology? It's no wonder the Union calls for our help. This might be advertised as a 'joint effort', but it really falls upon us to give the local inhabitants safety, seeing as they fell behind on the technological spectrum."
Overhearing the conversation, the commander of the squadron pitches in to save face. "Quit pestering the Renegade. You have not yet seen what the rest of the galaxy has to offer. Such naivete could lead to your downfall!"

choice.text: Point out the inadequacies of the Super Shield.

event.text: You explain that their shield can easily be downed in a reasonable amount of time through specific weaponry fit for such, and throw in the fact that overconfidence, just like their famed Super Shield, cannot guarantee their safety from whatever the greater galaxy holds. Agitated by this comeback, the rookie defies orders to stand down, and attacks you! The commander pleads to avoid unnecessary bloodshed, but it looks like you'll have to make use of some force to discourage your attacker.
You proudly display your weapons to the Zoltan rookie, and they awestruck at the sight. The commander thanks you for clearing the haughtiness of his subordinate and offers a reward.
You proudly display your Artillery to the Zoltan rookie, and they awestruck at the sight. The commander thanks you for clearing the haughtiness of his subordinate and offers a reward.

choice.text: (Upg. Drone Control) Show that you're not so behind on the technological curve.

event.text: You proudly display your sophisticated drone technology, taking the rookie by surprise. The commander thanks you for clearing the haughtiness of his subordinate and offers a reward.

choice.text: (Energy Shield) Show that you're not so behind on the technological curve.

event.text: You proudly display your own Super Shield, taking the rookie by surprise. The commander thanks you for clearing the haughtiness of his subordinate and offers a reward.

choice.text: (Shield Bypass + Bomb) Demonstrate a gap in his protection. [-1}]

event.text: You teleport a payload right in their weapon system, taking the rookie by surprise. He promptly hails you - "Bah, we never expected you Renegades to be such... assholes!" The commander offers you a reward, supposedly for showing his men how to improve, but you suspect the real motive is to avoid any further escalation and get you to leave.

choice.text: (Shield Bypass + Teleport) Overtake his crew before they can respond.

event.text: You teleport a boarding party through and wipe them out with ease, showing that the haughtiness of the now dead rookie was unfounded. You begin to recover some scrap, but the commander rushes to the scene to stop you!

choice.text: Ignore the arrogant Zoltan and dedicate time to doing something else.

event.text: You didn't ask for anyone's opinion, so it's only fair to tune them out.

event.name: DISTRESS_MILITIA_KERNELS
event.text: The source of the distress beacon appears to be an Orchid merchant under attack by a pirate vessel! Should we assist?
You power up the weapons and engage the pirate vessel.
Orchid ships are considerably well armed, so you hope that they'll be able to save themselves.

event.name: MILITIA_KERNELS_SAVE
event.text: The Orchids thank you for your assistance. They explain that they were sent to sell their Kernel weapons to the Militia vessels in this sector. As payment for your help, they offer one for free.

event.name: DISTRESS_MILITIA_OUTPOST
event.text: The distress beacon's source is a small Militia outpost under attack by pirates. The Militiamen don't appear to be holding out well.
You power up the weapons and engage the pirate vessel.
"Hey, who the hell do you think you are- oh crap. Okay okay you win, have fun!" The pirate jumps away. The fatigued Militia station seems defenseless against anything you might try.
"Thank you, it was unlikely we'd have survived that pirate attack otherwise. We cannot offer much other than some fuel that we don't need."

choice.text: Demand they surrender one of their crew as a slave.

event.text: The Militiamen have few options but to give in to your demands.

choice.text: Destroy the station and loot the remains.

event.text: As you expected, the Militia outpost barely defends itself and is destroyed quickly.
You decide not to fight the pirates.

event.name: MILITIA_AUTOSEARCH
event.text: You notice two Militia ships nearby squabbling over something. You aren't sure what without listening closer, but it seems to pertain to Auto-ships.

"Huh? Oh, I didn't notice there was another ship here. We're discussing the possibility of constructing our own fleet of Militia Auto-ships to reduce the number of casualties on the front-lines. But before we can consider, we need to capture one of the Rebel Auto-ships to study. Could you do us a favor and hunt one of them down?"

"Excellent. We've attached the co-ordinates of the ship we'd like to study, but it's located too close to an ASB. If you could lure it away without causing too much damage we'll be able to send in a ship to collect it."
"Oh my, this is marvelous! This will help speed up our development greatly."

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Have your engineer transfer Auto-ship data.

event.text: "Oh my, this is marvelous! This will help speed up our development greatly."

choice.text: (Cognitive Crew) Have your Cognitive transfer Auto-ship data.

event.text: "Oh my, this is marvelous! This will help speed up our development greatly."
"Understandable. Good luck with whatever mission you're on then."

choice.text: We have more important things to do than eavesdropping.

event.text: Whatever they're talking about, it doesn't matter to you. You ignore the Militia ships.

event.name: MILITIA_AUTOSEARCH_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Militiamen have asked you to bait out an Auto-ship for study.

event.text: You've discovered the Automated vessel mentioned by the Militiamen. In the distance you can see the ASB satellite swerving towards you.

choice.text: (Signal Diluter) Disable the satellite's targeting systems.

event.text: The satellite stops turning immediately, unable to detect your location anymore. You'll still have to lure away the Auto, but now you can do so without the added risk of the ASB.

You launch several flares close to the satellite, confusing its targeting system. Considering how small the discs are you doubt the satellite will be able to destroy them easily, giving you enough time to lure away this ship.
Just as the militiamen warned, the ASB locks onto your precise location and begins firing immediately. Hopefully we don't take too much damage before the Auto flees.

event.name: MILITIA_AUTOSEARCH_LURE
event.text: You've successfully lured the Auto-ship away from the beacon. You prepare to follow the ship to its next destination.

event.name: MILITIA_AUTOSEARCH_QUEST_2
event.text: You have tracked down the Auto-ship once again. Nearby are the Militia vessels from earlier, already inspecting the Auto-ship.
"Ah, very good job. The ship is still in working condition, marvelous! Here is your pay, of course."

As you prepare to leave, you overhear shouting from the Militiamen. You turn around to see the Auto-ship has activated once again, and blasts one of the Militia ships to destruction! It moves on to attack you next.

choice.text: (Upg. Hacking) Disable the Auto-ship before it can cause more damage.

event.text: You shut down the Auto-ship immediately. The crew of the destroyed ship evacuate immediately, and only a few lives are lost. The Militiamen thank you.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MILITIA_MISTAKE
textList.text: The wreckage of a civilian ship drift nearby, but before you can even think to salvage some of it, a Militia ship mistakes you as the attacker and prepares to avenge the civilians.
You get into some trouble over your identification with the Militia ship at this beacon, and not long after things get heated to the point of conflict!
The Militiamen at this beacon seem to mistake one of your crew as an infamous pirate with a heavy bounty. Not about to hand over your crew, you prepare to fight.
You try not to get into fights with civilians, but sometimes the civilians get into fights with you. Somehow you've angered the Militia ship here, and it's already moving in to attack.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_MILITIA_STATION_MISTAKE
event.text: You run into a Militia station near this beacon, who refuses to let you past. Apparently this beacon requires a toll to pass through.
The Militia station wastes no time with conversation - the second you refuse their weapons come online!
The Militia station collects the payment and allows you to continue.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_MILITIA_ESCORT
event.text: The ruins of what was once a Militia transport drift nearby. A Militia escort, their crew confused and afraid, mistake you for the attackers and prepare to defend themselves! You try to hail them but they won't respond, and it looks like the only way out of this is with a fight.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_PIRATE_MILITIA
textList.text: It takes a bold pirate captain - or a stupid one - to try and invade Militia space. When you notice the hostile ship approaching, you hope they're the latter as you prepare for combat.
A pirate vessel approaches, weapons already charging. They must be on quite the killing spree in this territory, and they're ready to take a break from Militia ships and fight yours!
It's ironic what a pirate problem Militia territory suffers from despite the heavy militarization here. No one will miss the ship here once you've killed them.
"Hah, I bet you expected a Militia vessel! Now you surely cower in your boots at the sight of my ship, yes?" You mute his comms mid-monologue and prepare to fight.
You catch the glimpse of purple fly past. Not long after, a pirate ship comes into view. "Haha! I have claimed the lives of many Militiamen, and now I shall claim yours! Prepare to fight!"

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_PIRATE_MILITIA_ONLY
textList.text: The Militia fleet boasts a large amount of ships, but this also makes them a prime target for pirates in need of a new ride. A pirate controlled Militia ship approaches, weapons blazing.
A pirate ship, looking to test out the new gear they just stole from the Militia, locks onto your ship and attacks!
At first you assume the ship here is just another ordinary Militia ship, until you see the pirate paint decorating its hull. Pirates inbound!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_MILITIA
textList.text: "The Rebellion shall never cease! All who ally with the Federation will be killed!" You doubt the moral superiority of murdering civilians only trying to protect their sectors, but if the Rebels want a fight, a fight they will get.

The Rebellion seem to hold a grudge against the Militia, though you can't imagine why. The Rebel ship here seems hell-bent on a fight, and since you're the only ship here they decide you will be a satisfactory opponent.
A Rebel ship has picked clean the remains of a Militia station. Nearly seconds after you jump in they spot you and decide to make you their next target.

The Militia tries hard to keep this sector clear of Rebel forces, but their defenses are incapable of keeping all of them out. A Rebel forward scout that has found their way into the sector spots you and attacks.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_MILITIA_ELITE
event.text: The vessels of the Elite Defense Cadre are some of the deadliest in the Militia fleet, and for good reason. Boasting highly trained crew, these ships don't mess around in combat. Unfortunately for you, the ship here deems you a threat and attacks!

event.name: MILITIA_DETECTIVE
event.text: There appears to be several Militia ships docked around a nearby civilian refuelling station.

One of the militiamen tries to protest as you dock with the station, but they are cut off by a human clad in a green outfit smoking from a small wooden pipe of Old-Earth design. "Ah, a Renegade, eh? I am Sherlock Haynes. I hail from Earth, though I have since joined the Militia myself. Now I work as a detective for the Militia, but I have been presented by a rather troublesome case. Perhaps you might help?"

"With the mystery of course! Last night, in this very station, a man by the name of Henry Coleman was shot and killed. We suspect he held vital information regarding a Rebel plot, but we aren't sure what. There were only 4 individuals staffing this station, and after this crime now there remains only 3. No ships docked with this station for a full 24 hours before and after the murder, which can mean only one thing!"

"Why, it's elementary my dear... uh, whatever your name is. This means that one of these 3 survivors must be a Rebel spy! The question is, which one could it be? Will you help me, my reality jumping friend, and solve this case?"

"Ah, most excellent! I haven't done much digging yet, but if you need any help just come and talk with me. Here are the three suspects, Mr. Thom Nicholson, Ms. Amy Sheppard, and Dr. Daniel Browne. I look forward to your hypothesis!"
"Ah, too bad. Better go then, I can't have any distractions while I investigate."

Haynes, aboard the other station, receives the hail, only to stare in shock at a mirror image of himself on the other end. "Me, listen. It was Thom. He used the Anti-Personel drone, shot Henry. Both of them are Rebel spies. He learned how to use the Drone Control from Daniel. No time to waste, Rebel attack imminent. Get the picture? Good. Hop aboard, we have a hangar to save."
Clearly something important has happened here, but it does not pertain to you.

event.name: DETECTIVE_EVIDENCE_MENU
event.text: You stand in the station's lobby, observing your surroundings. [You will be able to investigate as many times as you want in whatever order you want.]

choice.text: Speak to Sherlock or one of the suspects.

event.text: Who do you want to talk to?
The station has several systems on board. Which do you want to look at?
Sherlock raises an eyebrow. "So, you have come to a conclusion? Who shot ol' Henry?" [You will only be able to accuse suspects that you have talked to]

choice.text: None of them killed Henry personally. It was the drone who fired the fatal shot!
Er, nevermind. I need to keep investigating.

event.text: Sherlock chuckles. "Well alright then. Take your time, one can never be too careful about something like this."

event.name: DETECTIVE_CORPSE
event.text: You walk over to Henry's corpse. You notice no obvious cuts on the body, though there is a large burn mark on his back. This must have been from blaster fire, but the radius of the wound is too large to have been from a standard hand-held blaster.

event.name: DETECTIVE_ACCUSE_SHERLOCK
event.text: You take a long step towards the suspects, then swivel around and point a finger right at Sherlock. "You uh, you're accusing me? You do realize I haven't even been on this station before this day, right?"

choice.text: Sounds exactly like what a killer would say!
Sounds exactly like what a killer would say!

event.text: Sherlock folds his arms and glares at you. "You storm in here, spit on the faces of all my suspects, and then accuse ME of the crime? Get out. Get out right now. You are deranged. This is what I get for trusting a Renegade to handle serious business like this."

event.name: DETECTIVE_ACCUSE_DRONE
event.text: Sherlock looks as surprised as the rest of the suspects. "The drone, huh? An interesting theory indeed! But one catch - someone had to have been controlling the drone. Which one was it?"

Daniel looks shocked that you blamed this on him. Sherlock nods. "Yes, Dr. Browne is the head engineer here, which would make him an excellent suspect. HOWEVER, he could not have done it! If you checked the Oxygen system, then interviewed Daniel about it, you would know he was busy last night performing upgrades. He would not have been able to murder Henry AND upgrade the system at the same time, the Oxygen upgrade simply takes too long."

choice.text: You've already found a solid alibi for Daniel. You know it cannot be him.

event.text: Amy's scowl grows even darker. Sherlock shakes his head. "No, Ms. Sheppard could not have done it. She has no experience with the Drone system, it is too unlikely that she would have been capable of operating a drone long enough to kill Henry."
Thom's eyes go wide. "W-what? No, it can't be me! I don't know a thing about drones!" His easy going country accent suddenly disappears and his voice becomes uneasy.

Sherlock cocks his head. You explain how Thom actually got lessons from Daniel on how to operate drones, not too long before the murder as well. Sherlock contemplates this for a moment. "You're right. Goodness, even I did not catch that!"

Sherlock nods. "Yes, Mr. Thom is right. It was Daniel who was the head engineer on this facility, not Thom. It is too unlikely that Thom would have been able to operate the drone long enough to kill Henry."
Sherlock scowls. "You can't come in here making wild theories if you can't even say who did it! Keep looking."

event.name: DETECTIVE_ACCUSE_THOM
event.text: Thom's eyes go wide at your accusation. Sherlock gets up from his spot and walks over to you. "An interesting hypothesis indeed. However, if you inspected the wounds on Henry, you would notice a blaster could not have been the weapon used. Mr. Nicholson only owns a standard grade defense pistol. The only thing on this station capable of leaving such a mark was the Anti-Personnel drone, and Mr. Nicholson has no experience with operating drone systems."

choice.text: Indeed, the drone was instrumental for the murder. And who ordered it to kill Henry? Thom!

event.text: "W-what? No, it can't be me! I don't know a thing about drones!" His easy going country accent suddenly disappears and his voice becomes uneasy.

Sherlock cocks his head. You explain how Thom actually got lessons from Daniel on how to operate drones, not too long before the murder as well. Sherlock contemplates this for a moment. "You're right. Goodness, even I did not catch that!"

Sherlock nods. "Yes, Mr. Thom is right. It was Daniel who was the head engineer on this facility, not Thom. It is too unlikely that Thom would have been able to operate the drone long enough to kill Henry."

However, if you inspected the wounds on Henry, you would notice a blaster could not have been the weapon used. Ms. Sheppard only owns a standard grade defense pistol. The only thing on this station capable of leaving such a mark was the Anti-Personnel drone, and Ms. Sheppard has no experience with operating drone systems."

event.name: DETECTIVE_ACCUSE_DANIEL
event.text: Daniel looks offended that you would accuse him. Sherlock gets up from his spot and walks over to you. "An interesting hypothesis indeed. However, Daniel was busy on the night of the murder. If you inspected the Oxygen system, then interviewed Dr. Browne, you would know that he was busy all night long upgrading the system. This would not have left him with enough time to also have overriden the Drone Control and killed Henry."

event.name: DETECTIVE_WRONG
event.text: Suddenly, the lights go out, and blaster fire rings out through the room! When the lights come back on, the suspects and back up reinforcements have already fled. Sherlock shouts at you. "Damn it! Now the real suspect has gotten away! Run, it is no longer safe here with a killer on the loose!" Moreover, you return to find an emitter tapped onto your ship that broadcasted your location to the Rebel fleet, likely installed by the culprit in their escape. You must hurry up!

textList.name: TEXT_SHERLOCK_TALK
textList.text: "Ah, quite the interesting case, is it not? I do wish we knew how severe the victim's information was. Hard to judge how important this case might be. I've worked many a murder case, but none with such hypothetical stakes!"
"Unlucky they're all human, yes? Had one been alien we could have ruled them out surely. Or maybe not, and it would have made the case only more interesting!"
"Oh, I never grow tired of this job. Just wish I stopped landing cases involving murderous Rebels. I've lost quite a few partners to a stray bullet while chasing a suspect down."

Sherlock is busy polishing his revolver. "I'm a fan of Old Earth tech, the craftsmanship of their weaponry is quite astonishingly beautiful. If things here go awry, I hope I can trust my aim to put a bullet in the suspect's head before he puts one in mine."
"Do remember, you can never be sure if anyone is telling the truth! Put more faith into the physical evidence than a tale spun by a man."

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_THOM
event.text: What do you want to ask Thom?

Thom explains some basic details about his life. He used to be a farmhand on a small terrestrial planet before a Rock Crusader set fire to his town. With nowhere else to go, he decided to join the Militia and protect civilian space so such a thing could never happen to anyone else.

choice.text: Ask if Thom has any connections with the Rebels.

event.text: Thom shakes his head. "N-no sir. I've met plenty of Rebels in my time, but I've never been friends with any. I've always been a Federation citizen, and a loyal one at that."

choice.text: Ask Thom about his job on the station.

event.text: "I manage the essential systems. Back on the farm I had to learn how to operate various equipment, and it's incredible how much that knowledge translates to managing a station! I help with upkeep for the shields and life support, and I buy new parts at the store whenever something is broken."
"I've never actually talked with Henry much. He was always so quiet and reserved. Still, it's so strange to think he's dead..."

choice.text: Ask Thom about the other suspects.

event.text: Which suspect do you want to ask Thom about?

"Amy? She's uh, she's something I guess. She's always yapping at us, and she has the shortest temper I've ever seen. She does a good job though, and I wouldn't ever think she'd be capable of murder! Though, she never did like Henry."
"Dr. Browne? Oh he's such a kind old man, and dedicated to his work too. I can imagine he's quite shocked about the murder, he was always so close to poor Henry..."
For no reason in particular, you decide to spit at Thom. Sherlock glares at you but says nothing.
What evidence do you want to ask Thom about? [As you investigate more clues or evidence, more options will appear here]

choice.text: Ask Thom about the Drone system.

event.text: "Nope, never had the head for any of that drone stuff. I trust Doctor Browne for that kind of stuff, because I can't even figure out how to turn the drones on in the first place!"

choice.text: Call Thom out on his lie.
Ask Thom about the Sensor system.

event.text: "No recordings? That sounds problematic. You are a detective though, so surely you can figure this out without them, right?"

choice.text: Ask Thom about the Oxygen system.

event.text: "Oh, that's rather odd. That wasn't me who upgraded the system. I was busy last night during the murder, and I haven't had time to check it since. But I do know it was only level 1 the day before."

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_THOM_LIE
event.text: You point out Daniel's mention to Thom learning about how to operate the drones. Thom stutters, not sure what to say. You don't push further but take note of this.

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_AMY
event.text: What do you want to ask Amy?
Amy doesn't have a lot to share about why she joined the Militia. She thought it would be a good way to escape from her home planet and maybe kill some pirates.

choice.text: Ask if Amy has any connections with the Rebels.

event.text: Amy looks as if she's about to slap you, and probably would if it wouldn't end with her dead. "How dare you associate me with those crapstains! I ain't never been a Rebel, and I never will be. End of story."

choice.text: Ask Amy about her job on the station.

event.text: "Used to work as border patrol, until we got that god damn Anti-Personnel drone. I used to kick pirates in the teeth almost daily, but now I've been resigned to that damn weapons room pressing buttons all day long!"

"Henry? Hah, half the time I didn't even realize he was here. What a weirdo, always spending so much time resigned to that room of his, only coming out for food or water. Him being dead won't change nothin' about life on this station, which is a shame. It's so god damn boring here."

choice.text: Ask Amy about the other suspects.

event.text: Which suspect do you want to ask Amy about?

"Thom's such a pushover. He's always blabbering on about how nice life is here. There ain't nothing good about living on this station, I tell you! Still... Thom killing someone? Unthinkable... unless he's a really good actor, at least."
"That old man? He looks like he's about to turn to dust any second! I always thought he was as lacking a personality as the drones he works on. Maybe that's why he got along so well with Henry."
For no reason in particular, you decide to spit at Amy. Sherlock glares at you but says nothing.
What evidence do you want to ask Amy about? [As you investigate more clues or evidence, more options will appear here]

choice.text: Ask Amy about the Drone system.

event.text: "The drones? Never touched them. That damn robot stole my job at killing pirates. If I WAS a murderer, I would have gone for the Anti-Person drone instead of Henry. Damn robots can't feel pain anyways..."

choice.text: Ask Amy about the Sensor system.

event.text: "Guess you got no recordings then, or whatever. Aren't detectives supposed to be able to figure things out without recordings anyways? I don't know what you want me to tell you about it."

choice.text: Ask Amy about the Oxygen system.

event.text: "I don't know nothin' about the life support. That's all Thom's doing, not mine."

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_DANIEL
event.text: What do you want to ask Daniel?

"Me? I'm just an old fart. Studied drone tech for several years, got a job at Arcadia as an Engineer until I eventually retired. But... I guess retirement just isn't for me, so I signed up for the Militia instead of wasting away in some beach home."

choice.text: Ask if Daniel has any connections with the Rebels.

event.text: Daniel looks down at his feet. "Never been a Rebel, but I did have an experience with them. Back when I worked at Arcadia, I was put in charge of the CICA project. That's the Central Intelligence Combat Assistant, though it's more often referred to as the Free Roamer accident. This was the AI used by the Rebels to construct their automated fleet, but we never expected that they would use it for such evil. After I realized how my tech had been used, I resigned immediately."

choice.text: Ask Daniel about his job on the station.

event.text: "I'm the shipboard Engineer. After I finally talked the others into installing a dronebay and Anti-Person drone, I've been running maintenance on them ever since."

"Oh, poor old Henry. He was such a nice man. I used to eat lunch in his quarters. It's a shame the others never got to know him, because Henry was always so reserved. Oh Henry, how could this have happened to you..."

choice.text: Ask Daniel about the other suspects.

event.text: Which suspect do you want to ask Daniel about?

"Thom is a nice man. I was never as close to him as Henry, but we talked quite a bit, and he has always been a happy fellow. Recently, Thom took a particular interest in the drone system and asked me for help with operating the drones! He's learning pretty quick, but I think he might just be learning to give me something to do. I always wanted to have a student..."

"I wish I had her energy, I was never that amped up even when I was younger. Shame she wastes it all on shouting at us. Thank goodness she spends most of her time complaining to herself while she mans the weapons. I don't like to point fingers, but if any of us 3 were to go so low as to kill someone, I'd say she would probably be my guess..."
For no reason in particular, you decide to spit at Daniel. Sherlock glares at you but says nothing.
What evidence do you want to ask Daniel about? [As you investigate more clues or evidence, more options will appear here]

choice.text: Ask Daniel about the Drone system.
Ask Daniel about the Sensor system.

event.text: "The sensors are no longer functional? Oh dear, that's quite unfortunate. Surely even without the recordings though, there is some way to catch the person behind this!"

choice.text: Ask Daniel about the Oxygen system.

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_DANIEL_EVIDENCE_OXYGEN
event.text: "Oh yes, that was my doing actually! Thom normally works on the essential systems, but last night he was busy working with the drones and I had nothing to do. So, I decided to put my old bones to use and upgrade the oxygen. H..Henry was always complaining about the bad ventilation..."

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_DANIEL_EVIDENCE_DRONE
event.text: "Oh yes, of course! No ship or station is complete until its been outfitted with drone tech. I spend most of my time working with the system, though Thom has also been spending a fair bit of time in there as well after he asked me for lessons with operating the drones."

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_DOORS
event.text: You inspect the door system. It appears some work has been done on the blast doors to improve them, though it matters little in this case. All of the suspects and the victim are registered in the system database, so any of them can go wherever they please.

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_DRONES
event.text: You take a look at the dronebay. Though there aren't too many schematics on the station's computers, you notice an Anti-Personnel drone and a standard issue Combat Drone.
The combat schematic appears to only have been used a total of 3 times since the system was purchased. Further data suggests it merely came with the system purchase.

The computers inform you the Anti-Personnel drone has been used a total of 38 times since its purchase, though that's not surprising. With the influx of pirates in this sector, the number of boarders this station must see is unfavourably high.

event.name: DETECTIVE_DRONE_CANNON
event.text: You inspect the Anti-Personnel Drone's laser. To your surprise, the arm-mounted cannon appears to be much stronger than a standard defense blaster, and certainly capable of leaving a burn mark the same size as the one on Henry's corpse!

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_SHIELDS
event.text: You inspect the shields system. Everything here seems to be perfectly functional, and nothing is out of the ordinary.

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_OXYGEN
event.text: You inspect the oxygen system. The system appears to be running at a higher level than usual, and is in pristine condition. From the looks of it, the system was upgraded very recently.

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_SENSORS
event.text: You inspect the sensors system. It appears someone has sabotaged the computers, and deleted all of the recordings from the night of the murder! There's nothing else here of use, but someone had to have done this...

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_WEAPONS
event.text: You inspect the weapons system. Several trinkets lay around the room, as well as a small bag with Amy's name on it. This must be her usual station.

event.name: DETECTIVE_CORRECT
event.text: Thom realizes he's been caught. Desperately, he fumbles to grab his blaster but is shot in the knee by Sherlock. The other Militiamen run to handcuff him and escort Amy and Daniel to safety. Sherlock holsters his gun and thanks you. "Good work! Now, time we learn what this is all about."

Thom is tied up to a chair in an empty room aboard Sherlock's ship. Sherlock paces back and forth. "So, you're the Rebel spy?" Thom shakes in his chair, trying to loosen the ropes. Eventually, he gives up. "You don't understand! Everyone I knew, my family, my friends, they were all killed by the Rockmen! Is there any better proof that alien life is a threat to mankind? And during that attack, where was the Federation? Is the Federation really that great when they can't even protect their own citizens!"

Sherlock sits down in the chair on the opposite side of the room and crosses his legs. "So, you joined the Rebellion for revenge?" Thom nods. "The Rebellion offers a chance at the galaxy that the Federation could never give us! The galaxy that humanity deserves!"
Sherlock scoffs. "Alright, hold on the manifesto. All we care about is the information you tried so hard to prevent from getting out." Thom gulps. "I won't tell!"

You slap Thom across the face. "O-ok I'll talk! I was just a dormant agent sent to watch the sector. For a while now the Rebellion has been planning to invade this sector and lay siege to the Militia's hangars and armories, and today that plan is about to be carried out! Aboard the same station I was stationed at was Henry, another undercover Rebel spy. However, he grew too attached to that old man Browne, and when he learned the invasion would put everyone here - even the doctor - at risk, he got weak and was going to snitch. I secured the safety of the Rebellion by killing that coward!"

"Yeah, a real job securing them you did just now, blabbering all their secrets." Sherlock motions for one of the Militia guards to gag Thom and remove him from the room. "Damn it, if his intel's any good then we have a serious situation on our hands. We need to head to the central hangar and alert the General about this, quickly! Your ship seems a lot faster than mine, so I hope you don't mind if I catch a ride."

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: The shield reactor will be disabled in this amount of time. Be sure to defeat the Dreadnaught before the time runs out.

destroyed.text: The Dreadnaught explodes, scattering the area below in debris, even taking out a few ships on the way down. Fortunately, the generator takes little damage from the explosion.

deadCrew.text: The Dreadnaught has been emptied of crew. The ship falls back down to the surface of the planet, taking out several ships on its way. Fortunately, the generator takes little damage from the impact.

event.name: DETECTIVE_HANGARATTACK
event.text: It appears you're too late. Already, it seems the Rebels have begun the invasion. In the distance is a massive Militia ship firing on its own men, which can mean only one thing. The Rebels have already captured the ship, and are using it to lead their attack!

choice.text: Hail the Militiamen and ask if you can assist.

event.text: The Militia general responds. "Yes, for god sake we need any help we can get! A couple Rebel ships got in before we could raise the shield generator, but it's up now. Unfortunately, the Rebels have caused critical damage and that damn Dreadnaught is about to finish it off. We only have so long until the shield falls and we're all doomed! If we can destroy that Dreadnaught - or capture it - we might be able to repair the shield generator and keep the Rebel fleet away!"
You power up the thrusters and intercept the ship as it fires on the generator. Better make this quick!
Fighting a ship like that with a time limit isn't something you're eager to do. You power up the engines and ready to leave this place as soon as possible.
No way in hell you're fighting that thing. You evacuate as soon as possible.

event.name: DETECTIVE_HANGARATTACK_FAILURE
event.text: From behind you erupts a massive explosion, as a blue ball of light engulfs the massive shield generator and reduces the entire complex to ash! You've failed, and now that the shield is down the Dreadnaught jumps away and the Rebel fleet floods in.

You manage to evade most of the ships, but your hull catches several missiles and a nearby Dropship beams some soldiers aboard. Still, this could have ended a lot worse... Though this looks bleak for the survival of the Militia.

event.name: DETECTIVE_HANGARATTACK_DESTROY
event.text: Without the Dreadnaught to destroy the generator, the fleet stuck within the shield is rendered useless. They're swiftly overtaken by Militia reinforcements, and a team of engineers goes to work on fixing the damage immediately. The Rebel fleet arrives only to find no way into the hangar. They fire pointlessly on the shields but soon realize their efforts are futile.

The Militia General thanks you. "Had it not been for you, this building would probably be a crater in the ground by now. We cannot repay you enough for your assistance here, but we can certainly try." The Militia transfers over some supplies, and offers a blueprint for one of their ships to aid the Federation.
